synopsis: In episode #10 of the podcast, hosts Devam and Ahir welcome Rishabh Meswani, founder of the Fremont Debate Academy. The conversation delves into the importance of debate in developing critical thinking and communication skills, while also exploring the challenges and joys of managing a growing non-profit organization, all infused with humor and personal anecdotes.
quotes: The worst case scenario is never as bad as you think it will be.
It's important to find something you're passionate about that you enjoy doing.
You have to give yourself enough exposure to figure out what you truly love.
Sometimes, if work is really stressful, FDA is going to have to take the backseat.
Everyone should go try to figure out what's best for them.
Just because you care about something so much doesn't mean that another person does.
You have to be okay with the fact that sometimes you can't do everything.
You can't just treat people like tasks on a list.
If you think you have to do something, you might just be stuck in a gray state.
It's important to communicate expectations so that no one feels guilty.
